title: IHC's AED 5 billion Share Buyback Program
description: In 2024, IHC's Board of Directors approved a landmark AED 5 billion share buyback program to enhance shareholder value, leveraging strong financial position and robust cash flow, signaling confidence in ongoing growth and market potential.

opportunities.title: Financial Technology Solutions for Efficient Share Buyback Execution
opportunities.description: A company specializing in financial technology can offer platforms or services to automate and optimize the execution of large-scale share buybacks, such as algorithmic trading tools, real-time compliance monitoring, and secure transaction solutions. This enables efficient buyback operations, reduces operational risk, and increases transparency which aligns with IHC’s financial strategy.
roadmap_steps: Identify IHC's buyback requirements and constraints
Present a tailored fintech solution demo focusing on share buybacks
Negotiate implementation plans and pricing
Integrate solution with IHC’s existing systems
Provide ongoing support and updates

opportunities.title: Strategic Communications and Investor Relations Support
opportunities.description: A company experienced in investor relations and financial communications can partner with IHC to manage market messaging around the buyback program, create engagement strategies for current and potential investors, and produce supporting multimedia or digital campaigns to maximize the positive impact of IHC’s buyback announcement.

Develop strategic communication plan

opportunities.title: Capital Market Advisory on Share Buyback Structures
opportunities.description: A consulting firm with expertise in capital markets can advise IHC on structuring the buyback to maximize value, including the timing, volume, methods (open market, tender offer), and regulatory best practices. This helps mitigate risks, align with market expectations, and ensure regulatory compliance.
roadmap_steps: Conduct thorough market analysis and benchmarking
Identify regulatory considerations and compliance requirements
Recommend most suitable buyback strategies
Develop detailed buyback plan with timeline
Support implementation and monitor effectiveness

title: Release of IHC 2024 ESG Report
description: International Holding Company (IHC) published its 2024 Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Report covering the period from 1st January to 31st December 2024. The report outlines sustainability efforts, achievements, and ESG performance of IHC and key subsidiaries, including Multiply Group PJSC and Alpha Dhabi Holding PJSC (ADH). Notable inclusions are the adoption of AI-powered tool Aiden Insight for investment analysis, AAA ESG provisional ratings from MSCI for Burjeel Holdings and Emirates Driving Company, establishment of Greenhouse Gas inventories and science-based targets by PureHealth and Aldar, and various initiatives in employee health, gender diversity, waste management, and corporate social responsibility (CSR) contributions totaling over AED 37 million.

title: Aldar Properties' Ambitious Net Zero Targets
description: Aldar set ambitious Net Zero targets aiming for a 97% reduction in Scope 1, 2, and 3 greenhouse gas emissions by 2050. Its strategy involves eight key levers including low-carbon design, green construction, and tenant initiatives.

title: Alpha Dhabi Holding's ESG Integration across Subsidiaries
description: Alpha Dhabi Holding (ADH) encourages subsidiaries to develop bespoke ESG strategies and action plans aligned with Abu Dhabi Economic Vision 2031, UAE Vision 2031, and Industry 4.0. ADH guides its subsidiaries in adopting suitable technologies to drive sustainable practices across sectors including Climate Capital, Real Estate, Healthcare, Industries, Construction, Hospitality, Energy, and Investment.

title: MHI Launching Subsidiaries for Smart Water Technology
description: Mawarid Holding Investment has launched subsidiaries dedicated to developing and applying cutting-edge smart water technology to preserve water resources, reflecting focus on renewable energy and water-smart food security in 2024.

title: Multiply Group Develops ESG Integration Framework in 2024
description: In 2024, Multiply Group developed and implemented a structured ESG Integration Framework to embed ESG factors into investment decisions and stewardship processes. The framework includes a three-step governance process with new policies, position statements, delegated ESG responsibilities, and oversight committees. This allows for a systematic approach to managing ESG risks and opportunities across its portfolios while maintaining flexibility and requiring Board approvals. The Group also invested approximately AED 1 billion across three acquisitions in 2024.

title: Multiply Group Awarded Low ESG Risk Rating by Sustainalytics in 2024
description: Multiply Group was awarded an ESG Risk Rating of 16 by Sustainalytics in 2024, categorizing the Group as 'Low Risk'. The rating reflects the Group's commitment to effectively managing material ESG risks while generating positive impacts for its portfolio and the global community.

title: Multiply Group Achieves 83.25% Local Procurement Spend in 2024
description: In 2024, Multiply Group spent 83.25% of its procurement budget on local suppliers, reflecting its commitment to supporting local businesses and fostering sustainable supply chains.

title: Emirates Driving Company Receives Provisional AAA MSCI ESG Rating in 2024
description: Emirates Driving Company (EDC), a portfolio company of Multiply Group, received a provisional AAA rating from MSCI in early 2024, scoring 9.7 out of 10 and positioning EDC in the top 9% of companies in its industry for ESG performance.

title: Viola Communications Certifies as 'Great Place to Work' and Recognized in 2024
description: Viola Communications, a portfolio company of Multiply Group, became certified as a 'Great Place to Work' with a 90% satisfaction score. Viola was also listed among the top four companies in Best Workplaces in Media, Advertising and Marketing - GCC 2024, and received recognitions for Best Workplaces for Women 2024 and overall Best Workplaces in the Middle East 2024.

title: BackLite Media Certified as Great Place to Work and Ranked #9 in 2024
description: BackLite Media, part of Multiply Group’s portfolio, was officially certified as a Great Place to Work and ranked #9 on the Best Workplaces in Media, Advertising and Marketing 2024 list by Great Place to Work® Middle East.

title: Kalyon Enerji Awarded 2024 International Green Apple Environmental Award
description: Kalyon Enerji, a company within Multiply Group’s portfolio, was recognized for its efforts in renewable energy by receiving the 2024 International Green Apple Environmental Award for Sustainable Green Energy.

title: Multiply Group to Set Baseline for Greenhouse Gas Emissions in 2025
description: Looking ahead to 2025, Multiply Group plans to establish a baseline for greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions to enable future monitoring and reporting segmented by verticals for greater transparency and accountability across its operations.

title: Multiply Group Initiates Social Impact Assessment for Employees in 2025
description: In 2025, Multiply Group is initiating a social impact assessment for each employee to better understand and measure the broader social impact of the company on its workforce and society.

title: Launch of Century Village Worker Co-living Housing Project
description: ESG subsidiary developed Century Village on Al Reem Island, an approximately AED 360 million project providing dignified co-living housing for 5,500 workers, with recreational spaces, wellness facilities, and dining areas to foster a supportive community environment, addressing workforce accommodation needs in Abu Dhabi.

title: Implementation of Occupational Health and Safety Management System
description: ESG employs a comprehensive Occupational Health and Safety Management System with risk assessments, hazard identification, and regular training to ensure workplace safety and promote a culture of vigilance for all employees.

title: Adoption of Estidama Pearl Rating and LEED Standards in Real Estate Projects
description: ESG real estate development projects, including Reem Hills in Abu Dhabi and Albizya Bay in Seychelles, adopt Estidama Pearl Rating and LEED standards prioritizing energy efficiency, water conservation, and sustainable materials to minimize environmental impact.

title: Launch of Environmental Initiatives: Recycling and Mangrove Planting
description: ESG portfolio companies including Vision Furniture & Decoration Factory LLC lead efforts in recycling materials such as wood, sawdust, paper, plastic, and glass. Additionally, mangrove planting initiatives aim to restore coastal ecosystems, reduce carbon emissions, protect biodiversity, and bolster climate resilience.

title: Collaboration Between Gulf Dunes Landscaping and Tadweer for Waste Management
description: Gulf Dunes Landscaping collaborates with Tadweer to ensure proper recycling and waste disposal within the ESG portfolio to support sustainable development and reduce environmental impact.

title: Skill Development and Professional Training for Workers by Sawaeed Holding
description: Sawaeed Holding, a subsidiary of ESG, provides workers with skill development programs and professional training to empower career growth and support workforce advancement.

title: Launch of Reem Hills Sustainable Development Project in Abu Dhabi
description: The Reem Hills Project in Abu Dhabi showcases IHC's commitment to sustainable development by creating eco-friendly, luxurious communities. The project integrates sustainability at all stages, from design to construction and operations, adhering to the Estidama Pearl Rating System with certifications including PBRS, PVRS, and PCRS. It aims to balance progress with environmental preservation in line with Abu Dhabi's sustainability vision.

title: Launch of ESG Hospitality for Sustainable Tourism
description: IHC launched ESG Hospitality, a strategic initiative aimed at promoting sustainable tourism through eco-conscious construction and operations. This new venture supports the global movement towards responsible and sustainable hospitality practices, enhancing ESG’s focus on social and environmental responsibility.

title: Development of Century Village Project in Partnership with Q Holding
description: IHC, in partnership with Q Holding, is developing the AED 360 million Century Village project aimed at improving worker living conditions and advancing sustainable real estate practices. This initiative reflects a strong commitment to social responsibility and sustainability within real estate development.

title: Launch of Active Hub Program in Abu Dhabi Schools
description: In February 2022, Abu Dhabi Sports Council, Emirates Schools Establishment, and Palms Sports launched the Active Hub program, providing public access to sports facilities in schools across Abu Dhabi. The program offers classes in 13 sports disciplines and has recorded over 104,000 registered users with 870,000+ attendance occurrences since inception, achieving an 86.7% satisfaction rate.

title: Palms Sports UAE Warriors MMA Championship Events
description: Palms Sports organized 10 fight nights for the UAE Warriors MMA Championship, establishing Abu Dhabi as a global hub for mixed martial arts and providing a platform for athletes to gain international recognition and secure sponsorships from organizations such as UFC, Bellator, and One Championship.

title: Esyasoft's Expansion into European Market with Electrica SA Romania Partnership
description: Esyasoft, a company specializing in AI and IoT energy technologies, entered the European market in 2024 by forming a strategic partnership with Electrica SA Romania. This partnership enables Electrica to produce advanced green energy locally, supporting a sustainable and efficient energy system transition in the region.

title: Esyasoft Acquisition of 70% Stake in Float IoT
description: Esyasoft diversified its portfolio by acquiring a 70% stake in Float IoT, a Netherlands-based company specializing in meter reading services and remote asset monitoring for water companies. This acquisition positions Esyasoft to advance smart water technology solutions globally by combining AI-driven and digital twin technologies.

title: UAE Warriors Vocational Jiu-Jitsu Vacation Training Camps
description: Palms Sports organized 263 vocational Jiu-Jitsu vacation training camps benefiting over 42,000 students across the UAE. These camps are designed to enhance students' technical Jiu-Jitsu skills, maintain fitness levels during holidays, and help students realize their full potential.

title: S3 Strategic Collaboration Agreement at COP29 in Baku
description: At COP29 in Baku in 2024, Smart Sustainability Solutions (S3) signed a Strategic Collaboration Agreement with SOCAR Green and VEMA SA to deploy climate-friendly solutions in Azerbaijan's energy sector, focusing on methane abatement, carbon capture, circular economy, and water solutions to build a greener and more sustainable future.

title: Apeiro Collaboration with Social Health Authority for Healthcare Digital Transformation
description: In 2024, Apeiro, a subsidiary of Sirius International Holding, is collaborating with the Social Health Authority to advance digital transformation in public healthcare facilities, focusing on accessibility, equity, and sustainability to improve healthcare delivery, reduce operational inefficiencies, and ensure financially sustainable universal health coverage.

title: Aldar's Launch of Solar PV Project
description: Aldar Properties is operationalizing a solar PV project spanning 45 assets that will generate 12%-15% of the energy demand and significantly reduce emissions associated with purchased electricity.

title: Aldar's Integrated Waste Management Plant Launch
description: Aldar will complete and operationalize the first integrated waste management facility in Abu Dhabi, aiming at zero waste to landfill within the first year of operations.

title: Aldar Updates Net Zero Strategy Aligned with SBTi
description: Aldar will update its net zero strategy in alignment with the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) and Buildings Sector Guidance to enhance accountability and measurable outcomes starting 2025.

title: Aldar Achieves High Sustainability Ratings on New Projects
description: In 2024, 80% of Aldar's new projects achieved a 3 Pearl rating in Estidama, and 100% achieved a minimum 2 Star Fitwel Rating, demonstrating focus on energy, water use improvements, health, and wellness.

title: Aldar Invests AED 113 Million to Retrofit 67 Assets
description: Aldar invested AED 113 million to retrofit 67 assets, with 23% of these assets receiving LEED Gold or Platinum certification, promoting energy efficiency and sustainability.

title: Aldar Real Estate Decarbonization Pledge Expansion
description: The Aldar Real Estate Decarbonization Pledge, launched in 2023, grew to over 70 signatories including 60% of Aldar’s highest-spend contractors, with around 50% having emissions targets or developing them.

title: PureHealth Achieves 13.2% Reduction in GHG Emissions in 2023
description: PureHealth, the UAE's largest integrated healthcare network, achieved a 13.2% reduction in total greenhouse gas emissions in 2023, equivalent to approximately 90,344 MTCO2e compared to its baseline year. This progress is part of its Net Zero 2040 targets and includes improved GHG emissions tracking, monthly data collection across healthcare facilities, adoption of renewable energy, expansion of digital healthcare solutions to reduce carbon-intensive practices, and strengthened supply chain sustainability.

title: PureHealth Embeds ESG and Sustainability Frameworks in International Expansion
description: In 2024, PureHealth is embedding sustainability across its operations as part of its international expansion by aligning with globally recognized ESG frameworks including the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD), CDP, UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), and the Science-Based Targets initiative (SBTi). These efforts reinforce the company’s Net Zero ambitions and ensure that its global growth supports climate resilience.

title: PureHealth Deploys IoT-driven Energy Efficiency Solutions
description: In 2024, PureHealth advanced its decarbonization efforts by deploying IoT-driven energy efficiency solutions across prioritized healthcare facilities. This initiative enables real-time monitoring of energy consumption, identification of inefficiencies, and optimization of resource utilization to reduce environmental impact in healthcare operations.

title: IHC Subsidiaries Receive Provisional MSCI ESG Ratings
description: Various subsidiaries within the IHC portfolio demonstrated leadership in ESG excellence during 2024, each receiving a provisional MSCI ESG rating. These ratings highlight their progress integrating ESG principles and sustainability initiatives into core business strategies, underscoring commitment to impactful sustainability priorities across the group.

title: Trojan Construction Group achieves provisional 'A' MSCI ESG rating
description: Trojan Construction Group became the first construction group in the Middle East to achieve a provisional 'A' rating in the MSCI ESG assessment as of March 7, 2024, reflecting its leadership in sustainable construction and commitment to advancing sustainability across the region.

title: Trojan partners with Etihad Rail to introduce hybrid fleets
description: Trojan Construction Group partnered with Etihad Rail in 2023 to introduce hybrid fleets into its operations to reduce carbon emissions and minimize environmental impact throughout the value chain, supporting regional sustainability efforts.

title: Phoenix Timber Factory LLC achieves 70% FSC-certified wood products
description: Phoenix Timber Factory LLC, a subsidiary of Trojan Construction Group, reported that 70% of its wood products were FSC-certified in the last reporting year, maintaining full compliance with FSC standards for high-risk species sourcing, supporting responsible sourcing and greener construction practices.

title: Trojan Construction Group derives 98% revenue from green building projects
description: In 2023, Trojan Construction Group aligned with Estidama and Dubai Green Building Regulations, enabling 98% of its total revenue to come from projects meeting green building requirements, demonstrating strong adherence to sustainability standards in building construction.

title: NMDC Group Achieves AA 'Leader' ESG Rating
description: In 2024, NMDC Group received an AA 'Leader' provisional ESG rating from MSCI, recognizing its effective environmental, social, and governance practices. This rating places NMDC among leaders in the Construction & Engineering sectors, making the Group a benchmark for sustainability in the industry.

title: NMDC Group Renewable Energy Expansion and Offshore Wind Projects
description: NMDC Group is expanding its renewable energy presence by partnering with Byrne Equipment Rental to implement solar energy systems at Sir Baniyas Island residential camp, reducing CO₂ emissions by 475 tons annually. The Group is also developing, constructing, and maintaining wind power facilities including Taiwan’s Yunlin offshore wind farm. NMDC recently acquired a Dynamic Positioning vessel for offshore wind projects, expected to generate over AED 1 billion annual revenue, and plans to enter international subsea rock installation markets supporting offshore wind farms and subsea infrastructure.

title: NMDC Group Financial Growth Post-Merger
description: Following the 2021 merger of NMDC D&M and NMDC Energy, NMDC Group reported a 44% increase in net profit to AED 3.11 billion, a 57% increase in revenue to AED 26.26 billion, and a 36% rise in earnings per share to AED 3.55 in 2024, indicating successful market capitalization and operational growth.

title: Burjeel Holdings Achieves Provisional AAA MSCI ESG Rating 2024
description: Burjeel Holdings, a leading healthcare provider in the UAE, Oman, and Saudi Arabia, integrated ESG principles into its operations, developing a dedicated ESG strategy and standalone ESG Data Book. The company made significant operational improvements including emission reductions, advanced waste management systems, workforce diversity, and community healthcare investments. In 2024, Burjeel obtained a provisional AAA ESG rating from MSCI, highlighting its exemplary ESG performance across environmental, social, and governance dimensions. The company plans future initiatives targeting carbon neutrality, waste reduction, healthcare accessibility, and enhanced governance frameworks.

title: Emirates Driving Company Awarded Provisional AAA ESG Rating
description: In March 2024, Emirates Driving Company (EDC) earned a provisional AAA ESG rating from MSCI, placing it among the top 9% of companies in the consumer services industry. This milestone recognizes EDC’s leadership in sustainability, social responsibility, and governance, and its ability to manage risks and opportunities for long-term value creation.

title: EDC Validates Science-Based Net-Zero Targets with SBTi
description: During the 2024 reporting year, Emirates Driving Company set and validated science-based Net-Zero emissions targets through the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi), emphasizing its commitment to ambitious and science-driven climate goals aligned with the UAE Net Zero by 2050 Initiative.

title: Launch of EDC ESG Transformation Program 'Towards a Sustainable Future'
description: In 2023, Emirates Driving Company launched the ESG Transformation Program titled 'Towards a Sustainable Future' which focuses on integrating ESG principles into operations, improving governance frameworks, enhancing social impact, and advancing climate actions to achieve sustainability and Net-Zero emissions.

title: EDC Strategic Focus on Sustainable Procurement and Certification
description: Looking forward, Emirates Driving Company is advancing its ESG journey by updating its Net-Zero Plan in alignment with its recent acquisition of Excellence Driving. The company will activate sustainable procurement practices by establishing baselines with Tier 1 suppliers embedding ESG principles throughout its value chain and pursue key ESG certifications including MSCI ESG rating renewal and ESG 1000 Certification.

title: Mawarid Holding Investment Receives Provisional MSCI ESG Rating (BBB)
description: In 2024, Mawarid Holding Investment (MHI) received its provisional MSCI ESG rating of BBB, providing insights into key areas for growth and improvement in environmental, social, and governance performance.

title: MHI Awarded Dubai Chamber of Commerce ESG Label at Advanced Maturity Level
description: Mawarid Holding Investment (MHI) was awarded the Dubai Chamber of Commerce ESG Label at the advanced maturity level in 2024, recognizing its leadership in sustainability practices and ESG integration.

title: MHI Advances GHG Emissions Management with Automation and Climate Ambition Accelerator
description: In 2024, Mawarid Holding Investment advanced its greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions management by automating carbon calculation linked to its ERP system and participated in the Global Compact Climate Ambition Accelerator program to set science-based targets aligned with a 1.5°C pathway towards net-zero emissions by 2050.

title: MHI Engages Suppliers on ESG Compliance and Sustainability Performance
description: In 2024, MHI initiated ESG performance engagement with its top 30 suppliers by purchase value, requesting compliance with business policies and ethical practices. About 67% of suppliers responded confirming compliance, accounting for 70.5% of total spend value, gathering insights on human rights, labor welfare, environmental health, and anti-corruption.

title: MHI Expands Waste Diversion and Resource Efficiency Initiatives
description: In 2024, MHI expanded its waste diversion efforts by recycling 46,482 kg of waste batteries and 19,004 kg of waste electrical and electronic equipment (WEEE). Additionally, it reduced single-use plastic water bottle consumption by 75.7% via refillable dispensers and lowered photocopy paper purchases by 22.6% through print management systems.

title: IHC ESG Report 2024 Release
description: IHC released its Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Report for the year 2024, outlining the company's sustainability initiatives, ESG performance, and commitments for the coming period.

title: Establishment of Task Force for Recovery of Outstanding Receivables
description: In 2024, IHC established a dedicated task force to accelerate the recovery of outstanding receivables, ensuring financial momentum and liquidity while reinforcing accountability and governance standards.

title: Advancement of AED 5 Billion Share Buyback Program
description: IHC advanced its AED 5 billion share buyback program in 2024, acquiring AED 1.8 billion worth of shares during the quarter to enhance shareholder value along with targeted debt refinancing measures for long-term financial sustainability.

title: Introduction of Aiden Insight, AI-Powered Board Observer
description: In May 2024, IHC debuted Aiden Insight, an AI-powered Board Observer that analyzes decades of data to provide actionable insights and predictive analytics, enhancing corporate governance, operational efficiency, risk management, and strategic decision-making.

title: Re-election of Five Board Members with Commitment to Diversity
description: In April 2023, IHC re-elected five Board members for a three-year term, including one female member since April 2020, demonstrating the company's commitment to diversity and strong governance frameworks.

title: Chairman of IHC Expansion
description: Dr. Mohamed Somar Ajalyaqin was appointed Vice Chairman of IHC in April 2020, bringing nearly two decades of strategic advisory experience. Under his leadership, IHC expanded into one of the world’s largest investment firms, playing a crucial role in driving business acquisitions and investment opportunities.

title: Sheikh Tahnoon Appointment to Key Leadership Roles
description: His Highness Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan appointed Chairman of IHC in April 2020 and holds a number of key leadership roles including Deputy Ruler of Abu Dhabi, Chairman of Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA), and Chairman of ADQ. Since January 2024, he also chairs the Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Technology Council (AIATC).
tags: Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan
companies_mentioned: Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Technology Council

title: Syed Basar Shueb Leadership at IHC
description: Syed Basar Shueb became CEO, Managing Director, and Board Member of IHC in 2019. He led the company’s exponential growth through strategic foresight, operational excellence, and bold investments. He oversees a diversified portfolio spanning manufacturing, construction, financial services and more.

title: Sofia Lasky Appointment to IHC Board
description: Sofia Lasky was appointed to IHC’s board in April 2020, bringing expertise in asset management, mergers and acquisitions, private equity, portfolio management, and valuation. She has played a pivotal role in multiple acquisitions across real estate, contracting, food processing, preventive healthcare, and capital investments.

title: Mohammed Nasser Al Shamsi Board Appointment
description: Mohammed Nasser Al Shamsi was appointed to IHC’s Board in April 2020. He is an International Affairs Specialist at Presidential Level in UAE Ministry of Presidential Affairs and also holds board memberships in various organizations, enhancing strategic relationships with foreign governments and diplomatic missions.

title: Establishment of Board Committees for Governance and Oversight
description: IHC has established three key board committees to support governance and management oversight: the Audit Committee (oversees financial reporting, risk management, and compliance), the Nomination and Remuneration Committee (proposes criteria for board and senior management membership and recommends candidates), and the Follow-Up & Supervision Committee of Insiders Transactions (monitors insider transactions and compliance with regulatory reporting). These committees assist the Board in executing its responsibilities effectively.

title: Update of Risk Management Policies in Response to SCA 2024 Regulations
description: In January 2024, IHC updated its risk management policies in alignment with new Securities and Commodities Authority regulations. The revised policies are under review by the Board of Directors to ensure compliance with the highest governance and operational standards.

title: Partnership with Teneo for Crisis Communications Playbook
description: IHC partnered with Teneo in 2024 to develop a comprehensive Crisis Communications Playbook, including a Rapid Response Guide aimed at proactively mitigating reputational risks and operational disruptions across the Group.

title: Formation of Partnership with Emircom for Data Privacy and Security Enhancements
description: In 2024, IHC formed a partnership with its subsidiary Emircom to enhance data privacy and security. Initiatives include deployment of email security, Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR), centralized Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems, Data Leakage Prevention (DLP), role-based access controls, and operation of a 24/7 Security Operations Center.

title: Successful Mitigation of 42 Cyberattacks with No Data Breaches
description: Since onboarding a new cybersecurity service provider in October 2024, IHC has successfully mitigated 42 attempted cyberattacks, achieving a 100% success rate with zero data breaches during this period.

title: Development of Baseline Operational GHG Inventory
description: IHC began developing a baseline operational emissions inventory focusing on emissions at the parent level, including Scope 1, Scope 2, and relevant Scope 3 categories (excluding Category 15 investments), as a foundational step toward understanding and managing their environmental footprint.

title: Partnership with REE™ for Responsible Waste Management
description: IHC partnered with REE™, a software company specializing in recycling solutions, to implement a real-time dashboard for workplace waste management, enhancing transparency and traceability. The partnership included a staff education workshop to increase awareness about sustainable waste practices and introduced a technology-based waste recycling solution that encourages active employee participation in waste segregation.

title: Energy and Water Audit by Reset Energy
description: Reset Energy, a subsidiary of IHC, conducted an energy and water audit at the IHC Headquarters in 2023, leading to retrofits that reduced energy consumption by 23%. Implemented solutions included an adiabatic cooling system, optimized HVAC controls, upgraded lighting and controls, a state-of-the-art building management system, and a cloud-based analytics platform for monitoring and reporting energy savings. Recycling bins were also introduced at the headquarters to minimize landfill waste.

title: IHC Workforce Diversity and Growth in 2024
description: In 2024, IHC's workforce comprised 49 employees representing 22 nationalities, showcasing the company's commitment to diversity and inclusivity. There was a 15% increase in Emirati employees in senior-to-executive positions and a 6% increase in female employees, highlighting progress in gender diversity. IHC offers competitive compensation, benefits including life insurance, retirement provisions, healthcare, parental leave, disability coverage, and additional perks such as housing, schooling, transportation, and annual flight allowance. Two employees took parental leave in 2024 with full return-to-work rate. The company also ensures 100% of employees receive regular performance reviews for career progression.

title: IHC Corporate Social Responsibility Initiatives 2024
description: IHC is actively engaged in Corporate Social Responsibility initiatives aiming to create opportunities, support community development, and drive positive societal change. By aligning internal talent strategies with external community efforts, IHC builds a legacy of leadership, innovation, and shared success while supporting the UAE’s sustainable knowledge-based economy and Abu Dhabi Vision 2030 goals.

title: IHC ESG Report 2024 Highlights Diversity, Health & Local Economy Support
description: IHC published its ESG Report 2024 emphasizing its commitment to diversity, inclusion, and non-discrimination in the workplace, with zero tolerance for harassment or discrimination. The report highlights health and safety measures ensuring compliance with relevant laws, and proactive wellness initiatives through partnerships with Active Abu Dhabi, Pura, and Sanimed focusing on physical and mental health of employees. Additionally, in 2024, 50% of IHC's suppliers were local UAE companies, representing 17.75% of total spend, supporting local economic growth and sustainability.

title: IHC ESG Report 2024 Released
description: IHC has published its ESG Report for the year 2024, providing detailed demographic data on total employees by job category, gender, and age group for the years 2022, 2023, and 2024. The report includes statistics on entry, mid, senior, and executive level employees, showing percentages of male and female employees across these categories and age ranges.

title: IHC Releases 2024 ESG Report
description: IHC published its 2024 ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) report providing detailed workforce metrics including nationalities, gender remuneration ratios, new hires and attrition rates by gender and age groups, incidents of discrimination, Emiratisation-related metrics, and employee turnover rates for the years 2022 through 2024. The report highlights workforce diversity, gender pay ratios at various management levels, turnover rates, and compliance with Emiratisation policies.

title: IHC ESG Report 2024 Release
description: IHC released its ESG Report for 2024 detailing the percentage of Emirati employees by seniority, community investments, and comprehensive emissions overview including Scope 1, 2, and 3 greenhouse gas emissions. The report also highlights the company's efforts in environmental impact reduction, energy consumption metrics, waste management, and corporate governance performance with specifics on governance structure, board activities, risk management, and sustainability initiatives during 2024.

title: Publication of IHC Corporate Governance Report 2024
description: International Holding Company (IHC) released its Corporate Governance Report for the year 2024. The report details IHC’s group structure, governance framework, board roles, delegation of authority including powers granted to Chairman, Vice Chairman, and CEO via notarized Power of Attorney valid until May 2026. It also covers updated governance policies compliant with Securities and Commodities Authority (SCA) amendments effective 2024, spanning policies on conflict of interest, anti-fraud, disclosure and transparency, insider trading, dividend distribution, and subsidiary governance. The report aligns with Abu Dhabi’s Economic Vision 2030 and the UAE’s ‘Next 50’ plan and describes IHC’s governance across subsidiaries and joint ventures worldwide operating in 38 countries.

title: IHC Board of Directors Composition and Leadership Update 2024
description: IHC's Board of Directors for the reporting period ending 31st December 2024 comprises five members: an Independent Non-Executive Chairman, three Independent Non-Executive Directors, and one Non-Independent Executive Director. The Board's composition remained consistent during this period. His Highness Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan serves as the Independent Non-Executive Chairman. In March 2023, Sheikh Tahnoon was appointed Deputy Ruler of Abu Dhabi and Chairman of Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA), one of the world's largest sovereign wealth funds. Under his leadership, IHC expanded into one of the world's largest investment firms. Since January 2024, Sheikh Tahnoon chairs the Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Technology Council (AIATC), regulating AI and advanced technology policies to position Abu Dhabi as a global leader in AI.

title: Appointment of Syed Basar Shueb as CEO and Managing Director of IHC
description: Syed Basar Shueb was appointed as CEO, Managing Director, and Board Member of IHC in April 2020. He has experience spanning over two decades in manufacturing, construction, financial services, and investments. Under his leadership, IHC has transformed into the most valuable holding company in the Middle East with exponential growth and global expansion.

title: Appointment of Sofia Lasky to IHC Board
description: Sofia Lasky was appointed as an independent Board Member of IHC in April 2020. She brings extensive expertise in asset management, mergers and acquisitions, private equity, portfolio management, and corporate structuring. Sofia currently serves on the boards of Alpha Dhabi Holding, Aldar Properties, 2PointZero, and the National Corporation for Tourism and Hotels.

title: Appointment of Mohammed Nasser Al Shamsi as IHC Board Member
description: Mohammed Nasser Al Shamsi was appointed as a Board Member of IHC in April 2020. He is an International Affairs Specialist at the Presidential Level in the UAE Ministry of Presidential Affairs, managing strategic relationships with foreign governments and institutions. Mohammed also serves on the boards of Abu Dhabi Stem Cell Centre, Rabdan Petroleum Trading, and TALC Investments.

title: Recognition of Syed Basar Shueb Among Top CEOs and Sustainability Leaders 2024
description: Syed Basar Shueb, CEO of IHC, was ranked 5th among the Top 100 CEOs of 2024 and 3rd among Sustainability Leaders 2024 for Investment & Holding companies by Forbes Middle East. His leadership has been key to IHC's rapid growth, global expansion, and diversification into multiple high-impact sectors.

title: IHC Board Gender Diversity 2024
description: IHC has one female representation on the Board of Directors in 2024, reflecting the company's commitment to gender diversity and active recruitment of female employees across all operations.

title: Appointment and Role of IHC Board Secretary
description: Ms. Linda Ballout has been serving as IHC’s Board Secretary since 2020, responsible for managing all secretarial duties related to the Board including organizing meetings, maintaining records, disclosures, correspondence, and regulatory filings.

title: Initiation of Transfer of 2PointZero to IHC
description: The Board of Directors of IHC approved the initiation of the transfer of 2PointZero, a next-generation holding company that comprises several diverse and dynamic companies, into IHC during 2024.

title: Acquisitions of Strategic Investments by IHC
description: In 2024, IHC’s Board of Directors focused on acquisitions of various strategic investments including those outside the UAE as part of their expansion plans.

title: Appointment of Aiden Insight as AI Observer for IHC Board
description: IHC appointed 'Aiden Insight', an Artificial Intelligence Observer, to provide real-time insights to inform discussions and guide decisions during Board meetings in 2024.

title: Approval of AED 5 billion Annual Share Buyback Program
description: IHC Board of Directors endorsed the AED 5 billion Annual Share Buyback Program in 2024, pending regulatory and shareholder approvals.

title: Proposal of AED 100 million Board Remuneration for 2024
description: IHC proposed an amount of AED 100 million as remuneration for its Board of Directors for the year 2024, subject to approval by the shareholders at the General Assembly.

title: IHC Board Meetings Schedule and Attendance in 2024
description: The IHC Board of Directors held four meetings throughout 2024 on 26th February, 6th May, 6th August, and 6th November, with full attendances including some via video call.

title: Approval of Share Buyback Program
description: IHC approved a share buyback program via a special resolution of up to five billion Emirati Dirhams, representing approximately 0.6% of the Company's total shares. The program is for one year starting from the approval date by the General Assembly on 27th May 2024, with possible extension subject to ADX approval.

title: Approval of 2023 Audited Financial Statements
description: IHC Board approved the audited financial statements for the year ended 31st December 2023, including the Management Discussion and Analysis report for 2023.

title: Decision Not to Distribute Dividends for 2023
description: IHC recommended to the General Assembly not to distribute any dividends to shareholders for the year ended 31st December 2023.

title: Approval of Quarterly Financial Statements in 2024
description: IHC Board approved the financial statements for Q1, Q2, and Q3 of 2024 on respective dates: 6th August 2024 and 6th November 2024 for Q2 and Q3, and on 6th May 2024 for Q1.

title: Acquisition of 75% Stake in eFunder.AI Technologies Limited
description: International Financial Assets Holding RSC LTD, a subsidiary of IHC, acquired a 75% stake in eFunder.AI Technologies Limited, which operates a private financing platform.

companies_mentioned: International Financial Assets Holding RSC LTD

title: Acquisition of Additional 46% Stake in Emircom LLC
description: IHC Digital acquired an additional 46% stake in Emircom LLC through International Tech.

title: 2024 IHC Audit Committee Responsibilities and Reviews
description: In 2024, IHC's Audit Committee, chaired by Ms. Sofia Abdellatif Lasky, focused on monitoring the integrity of financial statements of the Group, compliance with laws and regulations, reviewing related party transactions, assessing internal control system effectiveness including risk management, overseeing internal and external audits, and ensuring timely resolution of audit findings to maintain corporate governance standards.

title: IHC Audit Committee Meetings 2024
description: IHC held multiple Audit Committee meetings in 2024 on 19/02, 26/03, 21/05, 14/06, and 12/12 to review policies, membership criteria, succession planning, and remuneration practices for the Board and senior management. These meetings involved committees from EY and Protiviti and focused on governance and executive compensation.

title: IHC Nomination and Remuneration Committee Activities 2024
description: The Nomination and Remuneration Committee of IHC performed its mandate in 2024, overseeing nomination procedures, remuneration proposals, and ensuring effective governance in line with the committee's charter. Members included Dr. Mohamed Somar Ajalyaqin (Chairman), Ms. Sofia Abdellatif Lasky (Vice Chairwoman), and Mr. Mohammed Nasser Alshamsi.

title: IHC Follow-up & Supervision Committee of Insiders Formed in 2024
description: IHC established a Follow-up & Supervision Committee of Insiders in 2024 to manage and observe insider transactions, maintain registers, and submit periodic reports to the market. The committee includes Dr. Mohamed Somar Ajalyaqin (Chairman), Ms. Sofia Abdellatif Lasky (Vice Chairwoman), and Mr. Mohammed Nasser Alshamsi (Member), focusing on transaction compliance and governance oversight.

title: IHC Follow-up & Supervision Committee Activities on Insider Transactions in 2024
description: The Follow-up & Supervision Committee of Insiders Transactions at IHC, consisting of senior members including CEO Syed Basar Shueb and committee members Mohammed Nasser Al Shamsi and Fawad Zahid, conducted multiple meetings in 2024 to ensure compliance with insider trading regulations. The committee guided the board and senior management on insider trading issues, maintained an insiders register submitted periodically to ADX, and ensured effective communication with regulatory bodies ADX and SCA. On December 23, 2024, the Committee Chairman issued a memo to all business units regarding rules and guidelines for securities trading and handling of insider information.

title: IHC Corporate Governance Report 2024 Highlights Risk Management and Internal Control Systems
description: IHC published its 2024 Corporate Governance Report detailing senior executive appointments, their remuneration, and the company’s risk management and internal control systems. The report highlights the Board's responsibility for risk management including setting risk appetite and maintaining internal controls. IHC conducts third-party financial and legal due diligence before investments and manages risks at its publicly traded subsidiaries under UAE regulatory supervision. IHC has partnered with Teneo to develop a Crisis Communications Playbook and Rapid Response Guide to safeguard reputation and prepare for critical issues, demonstrating a proactive approach to risk and reputational management.

title: Outsourcing of Internal Audit Function to Protiviti in 2024
description: In 2024, IHC continued to outsource its internal audit function to Protiviti, a global business consulting and risk management firm, which reports functionally to the Audit Committee. The audit process includes risk assessments and evaluations of internal controls to ensure effective risk management and governance across the Group and subsidiaries.

title: Mr. Daud Bin Farooq Serving as Group Head of Legal for IHC
description: Mr. Daud Bin Farooq, with over 16 years of diverse legal experience across jurisdictions including UAE, Pakistan, and England & Wales, is currently the Group Head of Legal for IHC. He has successfully advised on and ensured completion of numerous local and cross-border transactions, projects, and capital market listings contributing to IHC's growth.

title: Appointment and Audit Services by Ernst & Young for 2024
description: Ernst & Young (EY) was appointed as IHC's external auditor for the sixth consecutive year for the fiscal year 2024. EY provided external audit services amounting to AED 1,732,500 covering the annual audit and interim review of financial statements of IHC and its subsidiaries. Additionally, EY delivered advisory services through other audit firms with total fees of AED 27,551,577, including outsourced internal audit, finance advisory, corporate governance, taxation, and due diligence services for acquisitions.

title: Engagement of Multiple Consulting and Legal Firms by IHC in 2024
description: In 2024, IHC engaged various consulting, legal, and advisory firms including Protiviti, WTS Dhruva, AZB & Partners Advocates & Solicitors, Brunswick FZ LLC, Acquara Management, Renoir Consulting, Rubikz Consulting FZCO, Teneo Strategy UAE Limited, Ardent Advisory, Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer, Norton Rose Fulbright, Weber Shandwick FZ LLC, Adsero - Ragy Soliman & Partners, Angel Lane Partners, Hadef and Partners, Emirates Chartered Accountants Group Limited, Oliver Wyman Actuarial Consulting, and Edelman FZ LLC. These firms provided diverse services such as assurance, tax, transaction advisory, corporate governance, legal advisory, strategic consulting, and communication support.

title: IHC Corporate Governance and Compliance Review 2024
description: In 2024, IHC Group reported no material fines or penalties imposed by SCA or any statutory authority related to capital markets. There were also no cases of material non-compliance with relevant rules and regulations.

title: IHC Sponsorship of UAE Team Emirates in Cycling and Vertical Farming Initiative
description: Mawarid Holding, an IHC subsidiary via Alpha Dhabi Holding, partnered with Plenty Inc. to establish the first commercial-scale vertical strawberry farm outside North America, with a production capacity of 2 million kilograms annually. Mawarid Holding is also a key sponsor of UAE Team Emirates cycling team, promoting sport and active lifestyles.

title: IHC Sponsorship of UAE Team ADQ Women's Cycling
description: IHC, through its UAE Team ADQ, promotes gender diversity in sports by sponsoring the women's cycling team, creating opportunities for women to excel in competitive sports and fostering inclusivity and empowerment.

title: IHC Community Investment and CSR Initiatives 2024
description: In 2024, IHC's Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) investments exceeded AED 36 million focusing on healthcare, education, sustainability, volunteering, and sponsorships, partnering with Emirates Red Crescent, Ma’an, and the National Food Loss and Waste Initiative (Ne’ma) to promote sustainable development and societal benefits.
tags: National Food Loss and Waste Initiative

title: Aldar's Educational Outreach Initiative Supporting Low-Income Families
description: Aldar, a key IHC subsidiary, organized a community program where 100 employees packed 10,000 school kits for children from low-income families. Since 2017, Aldar has invested over AED 250 million in social programs supporting education and community development.

title: IHC Employee Health and Wellness Programs 2024
description: IHC prioritized employee wellness in 2024 by conducting workplace yoga and meditation sessions, a six-month bloodwork drive to detect stress markers in collaboration with PureHealth, and educating staff on stress management via Sanimed. LVL Wellbeing, part of IHC through Multiply Group, won the ‘Best Workplace Experience Solution’ award at the CBRE MENA Supplier Partner Innovation Challenge 2024.
tags: CBRE MENA Supplier Partner Innovation Challenge

title: NMDC Certified as Industry 4.0 Digital Leader
description: NMDC Energy received the Industry 4.0 Digital Leader certification from the UAE Ministry of Industry and Advanced Technology in 2024. This certification recognizes NMDC's use of advanced technologies including AI-driven connected workers, augmented reality systems, digital twins, and remote vehicles to enhance project precision and efficiency.

title: Al Seer Marine Secures Financing for Eco-friendly VLGCs
description: Al Seer Marine secured AED 863 million in financing in 2024 for eco-friendly Very Large Gas Carriers (VLGCs), developed in partnership with BGN. These vessels are designed to improve fuel efficiency and reduce emissions, advancing sustainable maritime transport.

title: Arena UK Adopts Sustainable Event Infrastructure
description: Arena UK adopted the use of responsibly sourced Hydrotreated Vegetable Oil (HVO) for peak seasons in 2024, reducing 700 tons of CO2e emissions. The venue also recycled 4.1 tons of wire mesh, preventing landfill waste and demonstrating commitment to sustainable event management.

title: Rebound Advances Circular Economy with Plastic Recycling
description: Rebound, an IHC subsidiary, played a critical role in advancing circular economy initiatives in 2024 by recycling plastic waste into usable products. In cooperation with Dubai Municipality, Rebound converted 3 tons of plastic bottles into furniture and processed 5 tons into high-quality recycled rPET, reducing 4.8 metric tons of CO2e emissions. The initiatives included workshops to raise sustainability awareness in communities.

title: Sirius International Holding Launches Sustainability Learning Programs
description: Sirius International Holding engaged its staff and partners in sustainability learning programs in 2024, led by its subsidiary S3. The programs focused on key environmental themes such as methane reduction, carbon management, circularity, and water management to empower sustainable practices.

title: NMDC Partners to Introduce Beach-cleaning Machines for Marine Protection
description: In collaboration with the Environment Agency, NMDC introduced specialized hydraulic arm beach-cleaning machines in 2024. These machines efficiently collect waste and debris from beaches, supporting marine ecosystem protection efforts.

title: IHC Initiates Sustainability Report Development for 2024
description: IHC hired an external consultant in 2024 to assist the Board in developing its Sustainability Report. This report includes detailed disclosures about its environmental, social, and governance initiatives and forms part of the Integrated Report.

title: IHC Share Price Performance in 2024
description: The IHC company’s share price performance throughout 2024, including highest and lowest monthly closing prices, and comparative performance against the ADX market index and the ADX Investment & Financial Sector index. The share price ranged from a low of 399.5 AED to a high of 416.0 AED, with an overall performance increase of 1.4%. Monthly performance relative to the market and sector indexes is also tracked throughout the year.

title: IHC Corporate Governance Report 2024 Released
description: IHC has released its Corporate Governance Report for 2024 which includes detailed distribution of shareholders' ownership by governments, individuals, and companies across different regions such as UAE, GCC, Arabs, and Foreigners. The report emphasizes the appointment of a specialized Shareholder Relations Officer with relevant qualifications and experience in legal and investor relation matters. IHC has also established a dedicated Investor Relations page on its website providing constant updates, financial reports, general assembly minutes, and other important disclosures in compliance with corporate governance standards.

title: Sale of 49% Stake in Alpha Dhabi Construction Holding
description: Approval of the sale of 49% stake in Alpha Dhabi Construction Holding Group LLC, a wholly owned subsidiary of IHC, to Abu Dhabi Development Holding Company (ADQ) or its subsidiaries on 10th June 2024.
tags: Alpha Dhabi Construction Holding Group LLC

title: Sale of Hospitality and Energy Subsidiaries by Alpha Dhabi
description: Approval for the sale of entire shareholding held by Alpha Dhabi Hospitality Holding LLC and Murban Energy Limited (including ADH Hospitality RSC Ltd, Murban (BVI) Holding Inc, Hill View Resorts (Seychelles) Limited) to National Corporation of Tourism & Hotels PJSC, with issuance of new shares to IHC or its related entities, approved on 10th June 2024.
tags: National Corporation for Tourism & Hotels PJSC
companies_mentioned: National Corporation for Tourism & Hotels PJSC

title: IHC Share Buyback Program Approval
description: Approval on 10th June 2024 of IHC's share buyback program for up to five billion Emirati Dirhams, approximately 0.6% of total company shares, with authorization granted to IHC’s Board for implementation.

title: Approval of Land Purchase and Share Transfer by National Marine Dredging Company
description: Approval on 29th August 2024 for National Marine Dredging Company PJSC to enter into a transaction with related party involving the purchase of land plots for commercial use in exchange for shares in one of its subsidiaries, with authorization for the company’s board to implement the resolution.

title: Emirates Driving Company Share Nominal Value Split and Capital Increase
description: Approval on 9th January 2024 to split the nominal share value from 1 UAE Dirham to 50 Fils, increasing number of shares and capitalizing retained earnings of AED 448,932,000 to increase share capital to AED 538,718,400 with issuance of new shares distributed pro-rata to shareholders. Further amendments to Articles of Association approved on 27th November 2024.

title: Aldar Properties Bond/Sukuk Issuance Approval
description: Approval on 30th December 2024 for Aldar Properties PJSC to issue bonds or sukuks with up to USD 1.5 billion aggregate face amount, callable perpetual or fixed tenor (5 to 60 years), offered internationally to eligible investors and compliant with UAE law, with approval for subordinated or pari passu senior debt.

title: Approval of Related Party Offer to Buy Stake in SAWAEED Holding by EDC
description: Approval on 27th March 2024 of a proposed offer from a related party to buy Emirates Driving Company PJSC's stake in SAWAEED Holding with authorization delegated to the Board to implement the resolution.

title: Transfer of 2PointZero Holding to IHC
description: In January 2024, the company 2PointZero, a next-generation holding company comprising several diverse and dynamic investment companies, was transferred to IHC.

title: Acquisition of 19.98% Stake in Elsewedy Electric SAE
description: In January 2024, 2PointZero Group LLC through its subsidiary Electra Investments RSC Ltd acquired a significant minority stake of 19.98% of issued shares of Elsewedy Electric SAE via a voluntary tender offer.

title: Appointment of 2PointZero Leadership Team
description: In January 2024, the leadership team of 2PointZero was appointed to steer the company towards transformative global impact and progress.

title: Appointment of Aiden Insight as AI Board Observer
description: In February 2024, Aiden Insight was appointed as an AI Board Observer at IHC to provide unparalleled data analysis and strategic insights to maintain IHC's industry forefront and stakeholder value.

title: Acquisition of 46% Stake in Emircom LLC
description: In October 2024, International Tech Group SP LLC acquired an additional 46% stake in Emircom LLC for AED 292 million and became a wholly owned subsidiary of IHC.

title: Transfer of 49% Stake in Modon Properties PJSC to Q Holding PSC
description: In October 2024, IHC Real Estate Holding LLC transferred a 49% stake in Modon Properties PJSC to Q Holding PSC in exchange for newly issued shares of Q Holding.

title: USD 500 Million Investment in Alpha Dhabi by GQG Partners
description: In November 2024, GQG Partners, a prominent global asset management firm, invested USD 500 million in Alpha Dhabi.

title: IHC Share Buyback Program - First Tranche
description: In April 2024, IHC announced its intention to buy back shares worth AED 1.8 billion representing the first tranche and 36% of the total buyback program.

title: Stake Transfer and Acquisition between IHC Capital Holding and Grupo Nutresa/Grupo de Inversiones Suramericana
description: In April 2024, IHC Capital Holding transferred a 2.03% stake in Grupo de Inversiones Suramericana SA and received a 2.45% stake in Grupo Nutresa SA; additionally, Graystone Holdings SA, a wholly owned subsidiary, acquired an additional 12.38% stake in Grupo Nutresa SA, a food-processing conglomerate headquartered in Medellín, Colombia.

title: IHC Board Endorses AED 5 Billion Annual Buyback Program
description: In May 2024, the IHC Board endorsed an AED 5 billion annual share buyback program to manage the company's share capital effectively.
